title: The army of Cyrus the Great of Persia takes Babylon (Julian calendar)
text: The army of Cyrus the Great of Persia takes Babylon (Julian calendar)

title: Battle of Hatfield Chase: King Edwin of Northumbria is defeated and killed by the British under Penda of Mercia and Cadwallon of Gwynedd.
text: Battle of Hatfield Chase: King Edwin of Northumbria is defeated and killed by the British under Penda of Mercia and Cadwallon of Gwynedd.

title: The city of Oradea is first mentioned under the Latin name Varadinum ("vár" means fortress in Hungarian).
text: The city of Oradea is first mentioned under the Latin name Varadinum ("vár" means fortress in Hungarian).

title: Nichiren, a Japanese Buddhist monk founder of Nichiren Buddhism, is said to have inscribed the Dai Gohonzon.
text: Nichiren, a Japanese Buddhist monk founder of Nichiren Buddhism, is said to have inscribed the Dai Gohonzon.

title: The Treaty of Salynas is signed between Grand Duke of Lithuania Vytautas the Great and the Teutonic Knights, who received Samogitia.
text: The Treaty of Salynas is signed between Grand Duke of Lithuania Vytautas the Great and the Teutonic Knights, who received Samogitia.

title: Christopher Columbus's expedition makes landfall in the Caribbean, specifically in The Bahamas. The explorer believes he has reached the Indies.
text: Christopher Columbus's expedition makes landfall in the Caribbean, specifically in The Bahamas. The explorer believes he has reached the Indies.

title: Because of the implementation of the Gregorian calendar this day does not exist in this year in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.
text: Because of the implementation of the Gregorian calendar this day does not exist in this year in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.

title: The Delft Explosion devastates the city in the Netherlands, killing more than 100 people.
text: The Delft Explosion devastates the city in the Netherlands, killing more than 100 people.

title: The Salem witch trials are ended by a letter from Massachusetts Governor Sir William Phips.
text: The Salem witch trials are ended by a letter from Massachusetts Governor Sir William Phips.

title: British and Spanish naval forces engage at the Battle of Havana during the War of Jenkins' Ear.
text: British and Spanish naval forces engage at the Battle of Havana during the War of Jenkins' Ear.

title: America's first insane asylum opens.
text: America's first insane asylum opens.

title: The first celebration of Columbus Day is held in New York City.
text: The first celebration of Columbus Day is held in New York City.

title: The cornerstone of Old East, the oldest state university building in the United States, is laid on the campus of the University of North Carolina.
text: The cornerstone of Old East, the oldest state university building in the United States, is laid on the campus of the University of North Carolina.

title: Flemish and Luxembourgish peasants launch the rebellion against French rule known as the Peasants' War.
text: Flemish and Luxembourgish peasants launch the rebellion against French rule known as the Peasants' War.

title: Jeanne Geneviève Labrosse becomes the first woman to jump from a balloon with a parachute, from an altitude of 900 metres (3,000 ft).
text: Jeanne Geneviève Labrosse becomes the first woman to jump from a balloon with a parachute, from an altitude of 900 metres (3,000 ft).

title: First Oktoberfest: The Bavarian royalty invites the citizens of Munich to join the celebration of the marriage of Crown Prince Ludwig of Bavaria to Princess Therese von Sachsen-Hildburghausen.
text: First Oktoberfest: The Bavarian royalty invites the citizens of Munich to join the celebration of the marriage of Crown Prince Ludwig of Bavaria to Princess Therese von Sachsen-Hildburghausen.

title: Pedro I of Brazil is proclaimed the emperor of the Empire of Brazil.
text: Pedro I of Brazil is proclaimed the emperor of the Empire of Brazil.

title: Charles Macintosh of Scotland sells the first raincoat.
text: Charles Macintosh of Scotland sells the first raincoat.

title: German inventor and industrialist Werner von Siemens founds Siemens & Halske, which later becomes Siemens AG.
text: German inventor and industrialist Werner von Siemens founds Siemens & Halske, which later becomes Siemens AG.

title: The city of Manizales, Colombia is founded by 'The Expedition of the 20'.
text: The city of Manizales, Colombia is founded by 'The Expedition of the 20'.

title: Criminal Tribes Act (CTA) enacted by British rule in India, which named over 160 local communities 'Criminal Tribes', i.e. hereditary criminals. Repealed in 1949, after Independence of India.
text: Criminal Tribes Act (CTA) enacted by British rule in India, which named over 160 local communities 'Criminal Tribes', i.e. hereditary criminals. Repealed in 1949, after Independence of India.

title: Uddevalla Suffrage Association is formed.
text: Uddevalla Suffrage Association is formed.

title: The Pledge of Allegiance is first recited by students in many US public schools, as part of a celebration marking the 400th anniversary of Columbus's voyage.
text: The Pledge of Allegiance is first recited by students in many US public schools, as part of a celebration marking the 400th anniversary of Columbus's voyage.

title: President Theodore Roosevelt officially renames the "Executive Mansion" to the White House.
text: President Theodore Roosevelt officially renames the "Executive Mansion" to the White House.

title: World War I: British nurse Edith Cavell is executed by a German firing squad for helping Allied soldiers escape from Belgium
text: World War I: British nurse Edith Cavell is executed by a German firing squad for helping Allied soldiers escape from Belgium

title: World War I: The First Battle of Passchendaele takes place resulting in the largest single day loss of life in New Zealand history.
text: World War I: The First Battle of Passchendaele takes place resulting in the largest single day loss of life in New Zealand history.

title: A massive forest fire kills 453 people in Cloquet, Minnesota.
text: A massive forest fire kills 453 people in Cloquet, Minnesota.

title: An iron lung respirator is used for the first time at Children's Hospital, Boston.
text: An iron lung respirator is used for the first time at Children's Hospital, Boston.

title: The military Alcatraz Citadel becomes the civilian Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary.
text: The military Alcatraz Citadel becomes the civilian Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary.

title: World War II: Japanese ships retreat after their defeat in the Battle of Cape Esperance.
text: World War II: Japanese ships retreat after their defeat in the Battle of Cape Esperance.

title: World War II: The Axis occupation of Athens comes to an end.
text: World War II: The Axis occupation of Athens comes to an end.

title: World War II: Desmond Doss is the first conscientious objector to receive the U.S. Medal of Honor.
text: World War II: Desmond Doss is the first conscientious objector to receive the U.S. Medal of Honor.

title: At the national congress of APRA in Peru a group of leftist radicals are expelled from the party who later form APRA Rebelde.
text: At the national congress of APRA in Peru a group of leftist radicals are expelled from the party who later form APRA Rebelde.

title: Cold War: Nikita Khrushchev pounds his shoe on a desk at United Nations General Assembly meeting to protest a Philippine assertion of Soviet Union colonial policy being conducted in Eastern Europe.
text: Cold War: Nikita Khrushchev pounds his shoe on a desk at United Nations General Assembly meeting to protest a Philippine assertion of Soviet Union colonial policy being conducted in Eastern Europe.

title: Television viewers in Japan unexpectedly witness the assassination of Inejiro Asanuma, leader of the Japan Socialist Party, when he is stabbed to death during a live broadcast.
text: Television viewers in Japan unexpectedly witness the assassination of Inejiro Asanuma, leader of the Japan Socialist Party, when he is stabbed to death during a live broadcast.

title: The Columbus Day Storm strikes the U.S. Pacific Northwest with record wind velocities; 46 dead and at least U.S. $230 million in damages.
text: The Columbus Day Storm strikes the U.S. Pacific Northwest with record wind velocities; 46 dead and at least U.S. $230 million in damages.

title: After nearly 23 years of imprisonment, Reverend Walter Ciszek, a Jesuit missionary, was released from the Soviet Union.
text: After nearly 23 years of imprisonment, Reverend Walter Ciszek, a Jesuit missionary, was released from the Soviet Union.

title: The Soviet Union launches the Voskhod 1 into Earth orbit as the first spacecraft with a multi-person crew and the first flight without space suits.
text: The Soviet Union launches the Voskhod 1 into Earth orbit as the first spacecraft with a multi-person crew and the first flight without space suits.

title: Vietnam War: US Secretary of State Dean Rusk states during a news conference that proposals by the U.S. Congress for peace initiatives are futile because of North Vietnam's opposition.
text: Vietnam War: US Secretary of State Dean Rusk states during a news conference that proposals by the U.S. Congress for peace initiatives are futile because of North Vietnam's opposition.

title: Equatorial Guinea becomes independent from Spain.
text: Equatorial Guinea becomes independent from Spain.

title: Vietnam War: US President Richard Nixon announces that the United States will withdraw 40,000 more troops before Christmas

title: The 2,500 year celebration of the Persian Empire is held (until October 16).
text: The 2,500 year celebration of the Persian Empire is held (until October 16).

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, the first of five books in the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy comedy science fiction series by Douglas Adams is published.

title: The lowest recorded non-tornadic atmospheric pressure, 87.0 kPa (870 mbar or 25.69 inHg), occurred in the Western Pacific during Typhoon Tip.
text: The lowest recorded non-tornadic atmospheric pressure, 87.0 kPa (870 mbar or 25.69 inHg), occurred in the Western Pacific during Typhoon Tip.

title: Japan's former Prime Minister Tanaka Kakuei is found guilty of taking a $2 million bribe from Lockheed and is sentenced to four years in jail.
text: Japan's former Prime Minister Tanaka Kakuei is found guilty of taking a $2 million bribe from Lockheed and is sentenced to four years in jail.

title: Brighton hotel bombing: The Provisional Irish Republican Army attempt to assassinate Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and her cabinet. Thatcher escapes but the bomb kills five people and wounds 31.
text: Brighton hotel bombing: The Provisional Irish Republican Army attempt to assassinate Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and her cabinet. Thatcher escapes but the bomb kills five people and wounds 31.

title: American actor Jon-Erik Hexum accidentally shoots himself with a prop gun. He dies six days later.

title: Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom and Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh visit China.
text: Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom and Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh visit China.

title: Two officers of the Victoria Police are gunned down execution-style in the Walsh Street police shootings, Australia.

title: A 5.8 earthquake occurred in Cairo, Egypt. At least 510 died.

title: Matthew Shepard, a gay student at University of Wyoming, dies five days after he was beaten, robbed and left tied to a wooden fence post outside of Laramie, Wyoming.
